Description: Red pottery ostracon, from the body of a vessel, with remains of three lines of black-painted Greek text on the interior and three lines of black-painted demotic text on the exterior.
Curator's comments: Almásy-Martin, A./Martin, C. J. 2021: Always Remember to Check the Back: A Closer Look at Some Published Ostraca in the British Museum and British Library, in: Stolk, J. V./van Loon, G. A. J. C. (eds.), Text Editions of (Abnormal) Hieratic, Demotic, Greek, Latin and Coptic Papyri and Ostraca, P. L. Bat. 37, Leiden/Boston, 33–56.
Bibliographic references: Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (51777) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/51777)
Acquisition name: Purchased through: R J Moss & Co
